headline: Trump's unchecked imperialism raises growing concerns
description: While the Trump administration's handling of the Venezuelan situation has revealed numerous contradictions, its intentions regarding Greenland have sparked anxiety and opposition among members of Congress, including Republicans.

headline: Venezuela, under state of emergency, stages illusory transition
Greenland: Europe rejects US threats over sovereignty but finds options limited
In Paris, Ukraine's allies express hopes and fears over US security guarantees
description: The coalition of the willing, a group of Kyiv's allies who met in Paris on Tuesday, said they were ready to send troops to Ukraine for a ceasefire if they were guaranteed that the US would deter any new Russian attack.

headline: Paris snow forces 140 flight cancellations
description: France's transport minister said around 100 flights were canceled at Paris's Charles de Gaulle airport because of snowfall, and a further 40 at the capital's Orly airport, as of Wednesday morning.

headline: Brigitte Bardot to be buried in Saint-Tropez as cause of death revealed
description: The French actress, who died on December 28, will be buried in the town's seaside cemetery. The religious ceremony began at 11 am. Earlier, her husband revealed she had died from cancer.

headline: 'Whoever controls Greenland influences a key area of European security policy'
description: In response to US threats to invade the vast Arctic island, the EU must implement close military cooperation with Denmark, supported by Germany and France, argues economist Guntram Wolff.

headline: Under Trump, the feats of the US military regularly run into the great void of the 'day after'
Roberto Saviano, writer: 'Venezuela is not a narco-state, but a state that uses drugs as an instrument for the survival of those in power'
UN accuses Israel of 'apartheid' in the West Bank
Saudi-led coalition strikes Yemen as separatist leader flees
Iran risks losing a key economic and military ally in Venezuela
After tragedy at Swiss resort bar, residents express 'anger' and 'shame'
AFCON 2025: Algeria reaches quarterfinals, Côte d'Ivoire also advances
Cold snap hits Paris's homeless population hard
Ukraine's Western allies agree on key security guarantees in Paris
France's political parties divided over US operation in Venezuela

EU offers extra funds to quell farmer anger over Mercosur trade deal
'If tomorrow, the US decides to seize Greenland, neither Denmark nor the EU has the means to stop it'
description: Donald Trump's military operation in Venezuela should show Europeans that the US is a predator for Europe, just like Russia and China, argues former United Nations under-secretary-general Jean-Marie Guéhenno.

headline: Maduro, the failed heir to Hugo Chavez's Bolivarian Revolution
description: The Venezuelan president, recently abducted by the US, was chosen by Hugo Chavez as his successor and narrowly elected in 2013. Over 13 years in power, he has eliminated political opposition, tightened control over state institutions and overseen a 70% collapse in GDP as a quarter of Venezuelans fled the country.

headline: US attack on Venezuela: What does international law say?
description: According to international law, 'fighting drug trafficking and protecting democracy do not constitute legal grounds for the use of force.'

headline: EU-Mercosur deal: France's diplomatic gamble falls short
Greenland is and must remain European
'A spirit of reconquest has taken hold in Washington, particularly driven by Secretary of State Marco Rubio'
